title: Singapore Megachurch Pastor Convicted For Embezzling More Than $35 Million
text:
Comment Kong Hee (R) with his wife, Ho Yeow Sun (L) 
Six leaders of a popular church in Singapore have been convicted of misappropriating more than $35.5 million church funds. The pastor has been found guilty in a bid to turn his glamorous wife into a global pop star was convicted of fraud , on Wednesday. 
The founder and senior pastor of City Harvest Church, Kong Hee, was found guilty with five other church leaders of stealing 24 million Singapore dollars ($17 million) designated for building and investment-related purposes through sham bond investments, after a two-year trial. 
The prosecutors in the case said, the six were also found guilty of misappropriating another Sg$26 million from City Harvest Church to cover their tracks. Ho, who starred in a music video with rapper Wyclef Jean, was not charged. 
Judge See Kee Oon found the accused guilty of criminal breach of trust or falsification of accounts, or both, on Wednesday. The church also said the Ho’s music could be used to attract followers to the sect. 
As per penal code, the maximum penalty for criminal breach of trust, which all six were convicted of, is life imprisonment. The six, however, were granted bail before their sentencing date, which has not yet been set. 
Prosecutors said Kong and his subordinates engaged in a practice called “round-tripping” by channeling money allotted for a church building fund into sham bonds in linked companies so they could finance Ho’s music career. */
